definition: to shoulder (a burden)/to bear/to suffer (a disadvantage)
shoulder/to shoulder (responsibilities etc)
to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)

sentences.english: The university teachers shoulder for the society raise the qualified professional personnel's important mission.
sentences.chinese: 高校教師肩負爲社會培養合格專門人才的重要使命。

sentences.english: He touches me because he woks hard to shoulder the responsibility for our country.
sentences.chinese: 他讓我感動是因爲他努力肩負起我們國家的責任。

sentences.english: He's willing to shoulder the heavy burden of flaunting his riches.
sentences.chinese: 他願意肩負起炫耀自己財富的重擔。

sentences.english: The teaching staff shoulders the responsibility of teaching and educating students.
sentences.chinese: 教職工肩負着教書育人的責任。

sentences.english: Here are the young men then, a weight on their shoulders, but love in their hearts.
sentences.chinese: 就是這羣年輕人，肩負重任，心懷夢想。

sentences.english: Iam frightened I donat know. Let me find out the supervisor in this section.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕我不知道，讓我來扣問一下該組的肩負人。

sentences.english: Europe and Asia face common challenges and shoulder common responsibilities.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲和亞洲面臨共同挑戰，肩負共同責任。

sentences.english: ORBIS International is a nonprofit organization dedicated to saving sight worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 國際奧比斯是非牟利志願機構，肩負全球救盲使命。

sentences.english: The construction company is fully in charge of the software of ingl erection work.
sentences.chinese: 建樹公司完全肩負完全安裝工程的行政管理。

sentences.english: They must have some special mission.
sentences.chinese: 他們一定肩負着某種特殊使命。

sentences.english: All these changes place lots of burden on people's shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 所有這些變化都讓人們肩負起更重的壓力。

sentences.english: Four feet off the ground instead of Ta Kong, a shoulder plow instead of dressing.
sentences.chinese: 四足離地而不踏空，一肩負犁而不虛有。

sentences.english: Education shoulders the important task of training the innovation talents.
sentences.chinese: 教育肩負着培養創新型人才的重大任務。

sentences.english: During your daily drive, everything you care about is riding on1 your tires.
sentences.chinese: 你每天開車時，輪胎“肩負”着你所有在意的東西。

sentences.english: Education and training of overseas students is an important mission of internal schools run by overseas Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 境外學生的教育和培養是僑校肩負的重要使命。

sentences.english: She was gifted with literary brilliancy while she shouldered the responsibility of supporting her family.
sentences.chinese: 她稟賦超凡的文才，又肩負着家庭生活的重擔。

definition: to take upon oneself/to assume
duty/responsibility/obligation
picul (100 catties, 50 kg)/two buckets full/carrying pole and its load/classifier for loads carried on a shoulder pole
to undertake/to carry/to shoulder/to take responsibility
to crane one's neck/to await eagerly/to lead/to show the way
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
in the capacity of/as
to practice what one preaches (idiom)
to guard a pass/to check on sth
heavy burden/difficult task/great responsibility
function/role
to extend/to spread/to popularize/generalization/promotion (of a product etc)
mission/assignment/task/duty/role/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
to play a critical role (idiom)/influential
to bear the weight/to sustain
to display/to exhibit/to bring out implicit or innate qualities/to express (a thought or moral)/to develop (an idea)/to elaborate (on a theme)
to be duty bound/to be one's unshirkable responsibility
